function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Deployment of secondary research approach from multiple countries increases the risk of introducing infectious disease-related guidelines or standards from high-risk areas.","Impact":"Potential adoption of guidelines or standards that do not account for contagious diseases, leading to increased risk of disease propagation in parking facilities.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive review of the guidelines or standards and integrate infectious disease control measures into the design principles.","Technologies":"Incorporate technologies such as ventilation systems, UV-C disinfection, and touchless entry/exit systems to mitigate the risk of disease propagation.","People":"Designers, architects, and stakeholders involved in the development of parking facilities based on international standards.","Owner":"Design and planning committees responsible for establishing parking design standards and guidelines."},{"Description":"Descriptive research involving on-site measurements and observations of a parking building increases the risk of exposure to infectious diseases for the researchers and personnel involved.","Impact":"Potential transmission of infectious diseases among researchers and personnel during on-site data collection, leading to health risks and potential spread of diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement strict health and safety protocols for on-site research activities, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and adherence to infection control measures.","Technologies":"Utilize remote sensing technologies and drones for data collection to minimize the need for on-site presence and reduce exposure risks.","People":"Research personnel, site inspectors, and staff involved in on-site data collection and analysis.","Owner":"Research institutions, universities, and organizations responsible for conducting and overseeing the research activities."},{"Description":"Adaptation proposal for car parking buildings may overlook the integration of infectious disease control measures, increasing the risk of inadequate protection against disease transmission.","Impact":"Inadequate precautions against the spread of infectious diseases within parking facilities, leading to potential exposure and transmission among users and visitors.","Mitigation":"Incorporate infectious disease control measures such as touchless entry systems, enhanced ventilation, and antimicrobial surfaces into the adaptation proposal for car parking buildings.","Technologies":"Utilize advanced air purification systems, smart access control systems, and real-time occupancy tracking to integrate infectious disease control measures into the parking building adaptation.","People":"Architects, engineers, and facility managers involved in the adaptation and transformation of parking buildings.","Owner":"Facility management teams, educational institutions, and organizations responsible for the adaptation and maintenance of parking facilities."}]}
